result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason P. Wiese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Use Different Name, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.47(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning September 23, 2022.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall begin no later than October 8, 2022 at 4:30 pm.  Defendant may serve his jail sentence on the weekends at the discretion of the sheriff's department.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason P. Wiese

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

9:45 AM - Defendant Jason P. Wiese in court.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Jason P. Wiese.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information to be filed mirroring criminal complaint.  No objection to no Information filed.   Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of  count 1.  Statement by Attorney Smith.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; 10 days county jail with huber and good time to begin no later than October 8, 2022 at 4:30 pm may serve on the weekends at the discretion of the sheriff's department.  Costs shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning September 23, 2022.
Status hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.

1:45 PM Defendant Jason P. Wiese in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney.  Defendant indicated that he is eligible for a public defender.   Defendant waives time limits for a preliminary hearing. District attorney requests a signature bond in the amount of $1,500.00; booking  Court sets bond as requested. - rt
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
